body.p: This page lists various developer hardware needs. If you are interested in supporting the FreeBSD Project, you might consider donating some piece of hardware on this list to the Project.
We provide the FreeBSD username of the developer who needs a resource, the country they are in (for shipping purposes), the equipment they desire, and the use to which that equipment will be put.
For information on tax deductions and process, please see the information on the main FreeBSD Donation Liaison office page.
If you would like to donate something on this list, please contact donations@FreeBSD.org.

On a general note, we need a variety of Sparc64 machines for testing and improving our Sparc port. Even small, old (or new!) Sparc64 machines are perfectly usable. No matter which country you're in, we almost certainly have someone local who could use it.

tr.td: Hosting for up to a full rack of 1U servers

New source tinderbox / continuous integration system. I have the hardware (including spares), but nowhere to host it. External bandwidth requirements are very modest, but a separate gigabit switch is needed for internal communication.
ATX motherboard with Intel H77 chipset, Intel Core i7-3770S, 32 GB (4x8) PC3-12800 memory with heatsink.
Upgrade main development box, which is six years old. No chassis, PSU or disks required.
Development/build cluster. Any kind of switch could work.
Permit work on FreeBSD in the absence of grid power.
Fast multiprocessor AMD64 capable machine (dual core CPU ok).
General build box to support FreeBSD work including ARM and multi-arch testing of patches.
Tape drive, preferably SCSI DDS-3 or later
1GB of low-profile PC133 SDRAM (168pin DIMM). Memory can be buffered or unbuffered, preferably one 1GB DIMM or two 512MB DIMMs. Low-profile is a must. ECC is optional.
More memory allows for better workloads when testing code in SMP setups.

(1) ACPI laptops that work, to test new code on.
(2) ACPI laptops that don't work, (to try) to fix.

(1) Enhance the acpi_ibm(4) driver.
(2) Enhance docking support.
2-3 build machines:Pentium4 2GHz+,20GB+ ATA66+ HDD,256MB+RAM, 100base-TX NIC,serial, etc.
FTP server:Pentium3/Celeron 1GHz+,10GB+ ATA66+ HDD,100GB+ storage (RAID0+1 desirable),256MB+RAM, 100base-TX NIC,serial, etc.
IBM PPC desktop or rackmount hardware with a POWER4/5/6/7 or Cell CPU
1GB or 2GB 72-bit fully buffered ECC DDR2 SDRAM 1.8V, 800/667/533MHz
Upgrade package building cluster machines at NYI to 16GB or preferably 32GB.
Upgrade package building cluster machines at ISC to 8GB or preferably 16GB.
36GB or greater 1" high SCSI hotplug hard drives
Replace old drives in package building cluster machines.
We could specifically use rack-mounted powerpcs (such as Xserve G5s) for our package building cluster in the US.
We could specifically use rack-mounted Sparcs (such as SunFire V120, V210, or V240) for our package building cluster in the US.
